intro: Gomphrena longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spiky flower heads that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. Gomphrena longistyla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
